common.model

Class AbstractType

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.model.AbstractType
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractLevel, AbstractMove, AbstractSquare

    public class AbstractType
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Allows Classes to be represented by a user defined String. -Used to distinguish between object types in a way that can be Displayed in Fields and understood by a user. -All subclasses must have a method that hides 'public static string type()'. -All other functionality is automatic based on that single static function.
    Author:
    Nicholas Panzarino
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getType()
      Allows instances of objects to return the String representation of their class type.
      static java.lang.String type()
      Static Method that Determines the String value of this type of Class.
      static java.lang.String type(java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractType> c)
      Allows a user to determine the String type() of a parameterized class during runtime.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • type

        public static java.lang.String type()
        Static Method that Determines the String value of this type of Class. This will be displayed in ComboBoxes or in String fields. All subclasses should override/hide this method.
        Returns:
